data.title: New cursor animation styles implemented
data.body:
These are 'blink', 'smooth', 'phase', 'expand' and 'solid'.

Resolves #7923

data.title: Renamed file still showing in newly-opened 'Problems' report
data.body:
Latest Insiders build, latest OSX El Capitan.
1. Cause a linting error in a JS file.
2. Rename that file within Code
3. Open the 'Problems' report (CMD+SHIFT M)
4. See a the name of the file as it was before renaming
5. Click it, be asked to create the file

data.title: Explore to introduce CSS variables from themes and use in workbench

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
It would be useful if we could introduce CSS variables to the workbench from the selected theme so that we can start using the colors in other areas of the workbench.

A quick hack in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/services/themes/electron-browser/themeService.ts#L361 with 

```
cssRules.push(`:root { --monaco-editor-background: ${background}; }`);
```

shows that I am able to pick up the color easily:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/16361111/ed5dabee-3b83-11e6-8d15-b11b117b334f.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/16361108/e8ecb604-3b83-11e6-8344-8297f55d40ac.png)

@aeschli any objections to introduce variables on `:root` for the colors defined in themes?

data.title: Extensions: bring back the separator from debug to extensions viewlet
data.body:
I actually liked the separator because it made it very clear that extensions have nothing to do with the inner-loop of development.

I am not sure why it was removed in the first place.

data.title: Extensions: Double scroll bar on Windows
data.body: This looks super bad and we should use the custom scroll bar if possible for the inner scroll bar and the outer scrollbar should just be hidden via CSS if possible. @isidorn if you have cycles next week, moving to you.

data.title: Support using environment variables in settings.json

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 (1511)

It would be nice to be able to use environment variables in paths in settings.json, this is not possible in build 1.2.1 and older.

In my scenariio I`m syncing VS Code settings between computers, for example:

// Specifies the path to a PowerShell Script Analyzer settings file. Use either an absolute path (to override the default settings for all projects) or use a path relative to your workspace.
    "powershell.scriptAnalysis.settingsPath": "%home%\.vscode\PSScriptAnalyzerSettings.psd1"

%home% is different on the computers VS Code is used on, thus it can`t be hardcoded.

data.title: Markdown preview incorrectly renders nested lists
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1
- OS Version: MacOS X 10.11.5

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a new .md file (Markdown fiile)
2. Put the following Markdown content (see "Non-working Code" attached) in the file.
3. Preview the Markdown doc.

"Non-working Code":

```
1. A (0 leading spaces)
  2. B (2 leading spaces)
    * C (4 leading spaces)
    * D (4 leading spaces)
      * E (6 leading spaces)
```

"Working Code":

```
1. A (0 leading spaces)
  2. B (2 leading spaces)
    * C (4 leading spaces)
    * D (4 leading spaces)
       * E (7 leading spaces) // this line has one more space than the "non-working code"
```

data.title: trimAutoWhitespace doesn'n work on Windows 7
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1
- OS Version: Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open code in an empty folder.
2. Configure trimAutoWhitespace to true
3. Create a new js file and fill with some valid code.
4. Add some whitespaces at the end of some lines or at beggining.
5. Save the file.

It should remove unnecessary  whitespaces but it doesn't.

I tried with all autoSave options

data.title: Incorrect HTML formatting with "html.format.indentHandlebars": false
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1
- OS Version: Mac OS X 10.11.5

Steps to Reproduce:

Here is an extract of HTML (Angular 2) code:

```
  <app-root>Loading...</app-root>
{{#each scripts.polyfills}}
  <script src="{{.}}"></script>
{{/each}}
```

Using `Format code (shift+alt+f)` command with default `"html.format.indentHandlebars": false` setting :

```
  <app-root>Loading...</app-root>
  {{#each scripts.polyfills}}
  <script src="{{.}}"></script> {{/each}}  
```

instead of :

```
  <app-root>Loading...</app-root>
{{#each scripts.polyfills}}
  <script src="{{.}}"></script>
{{/each}}
```

I expect unchanged Angular/handlebar indentation with `"html.format.indentHandlebars": false`

data.title: tasks.json - cwd property in task objects

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.0-insider
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.5
- Language: C#

Steps to Reproduce:

My project structure is
global.json
.vscode (with launch.json and task.json)
src (folder) -> 2 Web Projects with 4 ClassLibaries that are shared between them

in the .vscode folder I have configured the launch.json
with two configurations, one for each web project from the src folder.
Now I need two build tasks for the configurations above but the
"options" -> "cwd" property can only set once global. So the problem 
is here that the cwd should set in the specified build tasks like this.

`"tasks": [
   {
      "taskName" : "buildApp1",
     "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}/src/WebApp1",
     ---
   },
{
      "taskName" : "buildApp2",
     "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}/src/WebApp2",
     ---
   },
]`

at the moment its this so i has always change the cwd if I want to debug the other project:
`"options": {
        "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}/src/WebApp1/"
    }, "tasks" : [ {"taskname": "buildApp1"} ..."]`

data.title: Integrated terminal does not recognize when a folder is deleted in the explorer

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.0 Insider
- OS Version: Windows 10 x64

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a folder with files in the explorer
2. Open a integrated terminal 
3. Delete that folder - confirm deletion with yes -
4. cd to the deleted folder - its still existing -
5. close the integrated terminal
6. Open an integrated terminal again
7. cd to the deleted folder , its still there.

data.title: Integrated terminal no longer handles `exit` correctly
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:
1. ctrl+backtick
2. "exit", can no longer view and/or toggle terminal

data.title: Workbench to support left hand side of diff editor to be editable

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
It seems that the left hand side of a diff editor is now suddenly editable with the new search & replace preview feature. The workbench is not really fit for allowing other editors (non-file, non-file-diff) to be editable nor do I believe is it discoverable or expected to be able to type on the left hand side. You will quickly notice that typing in the left hand side suddenly opens the file (as a tab in the background) and you also do not get any dirty indicators in the title area of the editor.

If we want the diff to be editable I suggest to do what we do when you compare 2 files or open a git change: The right hand side is editable because the right hand side is an instance of `FileEditorInput`.

Otherwise, please disable editing to the left until we have a story from the workbench to make this happen.

Steps to Reproduce:

3. Run command `Emmet: update tag`
#### Problem (tag without text)

data.title: vscode hangs by hitting <tab> in the editor (easily reproducible)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1
- OS Version: Arch Linux

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Save the following as a .css file:

```
.test {
white-space: pre-line;"
}
```
1. Open the file in vscode.
2. Place the cursor at the beginning of the second line (before white-space).
3. Hit tab.

The editor hangs with 100% CPU on a core, needs kill -9 to die.

I am able to reproduce this every time without failure.

data.title: Debug key shortcut does not work in Mac
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1
- OS Version: Mac OS X 10.11.5

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Build a simple C# hello world app.
2. Insert a break point and start debug.
3. The key F10(Step Over), F11(Step Into) does not work because the default keyboard function of the two button is volume down and volume up.

data.title: vim extension issue with Chinese IME
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 professional

I tried two Vim extensions, [amVim](ResolutionScale) and [VsCodeVim](https://github.com/VSCodeVim/Vim), both have problems when using Chinese IME:
- [Input Chinese word doesn't work correctly](https://github.com/aioutecism/amVim-for-VSCode/issues/101)
- [issue with Chinese IME](https://github.com/VSCodeVim/Vim/issues/341)

from the comments of the issues: it is not only affect Windows, but also OSX and Linux; and not only Chinese, but also Japanese.

So, it is highly suspect this is an issue of VSC instead of the extensions.

data.title: Change Explorer Open In New Command Prompt Context Menu to use Integrated Terminal
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2+
- OS Version: ALL

I would like this to launch the integrated experience to aid in discover-ability.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Right click on a file
2. Should open in integrated terminal with the right folder context

data.title: CompletionItemKind/SymbolKind starts at 1 in languageserver but 0 in vscode
data.body:
Is there a reason that `CompletionItemKind` starts at `1` in the `vscode-languageserver` and in the `vscode` library it starts at `0`?

``` js
export declare enum CompletionItemKind {
    Text = 1,
    Method = 2,
    Function = 3,
    Constructor = 4,
    Field = 5,
    Variable = 6,
    Class = 7,
    Interface = 8,
    Module = 9,
    Property = 10,
    Unit = 11,
    Value = 12,
    Enum = 13,
    Keyword = 14,
    Snippet = 15,
    Color = 16,
    File = 17,
    Reference = 18,
}
```

data.title: Markdown preview does not toggle as expected in tabs
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.0-insider (commit de66522, 2016-06-24)
- OS Version: Win10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Use 'code-insiders .' to open a repo.
2. Click an md file to open it.  Type some text into the file.
3. Click another md file.  It opens in a new tab.
4. CTRL+SHIFT+V to preview the second file.
5. Three tabs are now open, two raw md and the one with a preview of the second md.
6. Now click tab 1.
7. Now click tab 3.
8. CTRL+SHIFT+V.

Expected: we go back to tab 2, because that is the raw md for the file previewed in tab 3.
Actual: we go back to tab 1, which is raw md for a completely different file.
@gregvanl this is the issue we discussed.

data.title: Get CompletionItemKind at position
data.body:
I have a `DefinitionProvider`, and I was wondering is there a way to get the `CompletionItemKind` at a particular position?

So take this for example:

``` php
Database::get();
```

When I <kbd>Ctrl+Click</kbd> on `Database` I would get the `Class` `CompletionItemKind`

data.title: Add update all extensions button/command
data.body: As far as I can see this doesn't exist yet.
